eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyName: Take Me Out to the Grand Bazaar
storyInfo: Zubayr tells Pepe that he needs three other gems to help her find the treasury, and the pair search the Menat-Ha'mait night. On the other side of the city, Lazvar, overseer of the gem trading post, instructs his pets to locate the gems.

attributes.content: Titi...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Fetch!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: (Fetches the ball)
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: (Brings it back)
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: Who's the cutest little thing? You are!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Stop fooling around, Titi!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I've always wanted a pet, but my family wouldn't let me have one. Look how cute it is!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: It's not a pet, its part of the museum's collection.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Tell that to Pepe. She's yelling at part of the museum's collection.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: SAY THAT AGAIN?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I apologize, Pepe Khanum, but I am unable to answer. My memories of the trove's location remain vague.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: You sure you don't want to stop her? I'm starting to feel sorry for that corpse cowering in a corner.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Well, try harder! Maybe you'll remember then.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'm afraid that would be futile...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: They who split my memories distributed them evenly across all the gems, to ensure that the secret could not be easily accessed.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: There are five gems in total. You may have to find all of them before I can tell you the answer.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Where are the rest of the gems? You must know that, right?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: You don't?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The army that defeated me consisted of many padishahs and lords ameer... They took the gems with them when they left.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: It's like looking for a needle in a haystack...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: There must be another way! Use that golden brain of yours!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Zubayr is forced into a corner by Pepe, even as the short girl doesn't come up to his chest.
He feels a pressure so great, it threatens to buckle even his hardened metal kneecaps.
Please, hanimefendi... have patience...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Then tell me something useful!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: There is a faint resonance between the gems that I can sense if I am in their proximity.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Are you kidding me? You want me to take you across all of Sargon? This city alone holds thousands of gems!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I think I sense one faintly...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Well, what are we waiting for? Let's go!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Look, Anat, she's trying to remove part of the museum's collection!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Pepe, Zubayr Effendi is a valued part of the museum's collection. We must ensure that he is stored under appropriate conditions, and I can't allow him to be exposed to the elements.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Leave that thought and do your research here. Do NOT go out.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Forty-percent increase in funding next year?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Double?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: My staff will be watching you at all times. Senebty.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: What's come over her?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Zubayr Effendi, I know it's not exactly polite to ask a man for his funeral effects, but I would be remiss...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Can I borrow this for a couple of days?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: (Spins rapidly)
attributes.name: Jewel Construct

attributes.content: Of course, hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: You can come out now, Zubayr. There's no one here.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: How do you go through a hole like that at your size? It's like you turned liquid or something.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: My body is extremely flexible, allowing me to pass through narrow spaces.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I thought I would have to tear down the wall, if you couldn't get out.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: There is no need.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Zubayr closes his eyes and shakes his sistrum.
As the chimes ring, the wall around the hole slowly turns to sand, falling to the ground, leaving behind a much bigger hole.
With eyes wide, Pepe walks back and forth through the hole, then picks up a handful of sand.
Why didn't you use your Originium Arts? I almost hit my head crawling through the hole.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You didn't ask.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Well... you should close it back up. Wouldn't want anyone else to see it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: As you wish.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: The chimes ring again, and sand flows back into the hole. Soon, there is no sign that the hole was ever there.
Centuries ago, there was nothing but sand. Now, tall buildings line the streets. Such prosperity.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Lamps line the banks of the river flowing gently through the city. It reminds me of Shar-Cheshmeh, built upon an oasis.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Shahr-Cheshmeh, the City of Springs? I thought it was just a legend. No one has found it in centuries.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: No, it was very real. Its padishah was a despot who challenged the Shah's authority on multiple occasions. I had to pay him a personal visit.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: And then?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: And then it was no more.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Did... the whole city have to pay for the sins of a single padishah?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I did nothing but cut the padishah's head off and throw it into a spring. It was the chained slaves who burned the city to the ground.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: If you visited yourself, you would be shocked by the filth and stink. They made sacrifices in the water, but the water system was... primitive.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Please, stop. I can almost smell it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I see. Can we go to the river?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: No, not that way!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: It's early. The banks of the river are still brightly lit. Anat would kill me if someone saw the museum's collection walking the streets.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I know a place. Follow me.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Curator Anat, we've taken inventory of the collection. Here it is...
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: ...Medjehtiqedti Khanum? What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Anat went to meet a guest, so I'm taking over some of the documents.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: 'The Padishah's statue wasn't damaged in an accident; it was missing one eyeball to begin with! Who wrote this?'
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Ha...
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: How's my impression?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: But it's true that the statue's records are wrong. Be careful next time.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: R-Really? Let me see who was in charge.
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Izaja and Inaja. I think they were under your...
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Ahem... here, Age of Shadow exhibits counted twice. Make sure you double-check.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: This is...?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: My favorite place in the city.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You like empty streets.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: It's not like this during the day. Everything in Menat-Ha'mait goes through here.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Merchants from all across the country come here to trade gems, furs, spices, crafts... people come from other countries too, often making large transactions.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: If we're going to find a gem somewhere, this would be it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Deep in the Grand Bazaar is a trading post dedicated to gems. Virtually every gem in the city passes through it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Do you sense the gem we're looking for?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Are you listening?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Forgive me...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I am curious about the crafts being sold here. In my time, animal sculptures like these were guardians of tombs, companions for the dead.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Now, though, they are being peddled on the streets as everyday items.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Well... it's a decorative sculpture for home use. Twenty-five dinars.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: From the murals on the walls, to the hieroglyphs all around... many things feel so familiar, yet so strange at the same time.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Perhaps we should go and see a few more places?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Medjehtiqedti Hanimefendi, the great families have sent inquiries.
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: The padishahs take the solemnity of Sargonian history so seriously. How do we explain this incident to them?
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Just tell them it was an intern's mistake and we'll deal with it accordingly.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Deal with whom?
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: The acting curator, perhaps?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Is it really true, Titi?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: There was unexplained access made using your pass both last night and this morning... what if someone investigates?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: That can't be! I wiped all the records clean.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: So you've finally admitted it.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I didn't... I...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Well, this I can cover up... but the mummy coming back to life, on the eve of the Flood Festival, is another matter.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: What's your plan?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: To keep the museum closed until things blow over.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: No way!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Look at that badgir!
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: A windcatcher, yes, the most common type of tower here. Those openings catch the cool, high winds and guide them into the building through vents.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Cool air flows into the space below, pushing the hot air out the opposite side.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I didn't know you were an architect.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'm not. But I met the talented architect who invented the badgir.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Do you sense the gems yet?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I can't sense any nearby. Maybe I could tell you something else.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Are you not curious how the gems retain one's memory and consciousness?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I AM curious. I figured it was some kind of Sarkaz witchcraft related to the Zhayedan.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: People in my time believed that life consists of three parts: Body, Name, and Soul.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Body is the physical vessel, and Name is the identity known to others. The Soul, however, is what truly makes us human; it is the emotions and experiences that form our character.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: All three parts must be preserved together, in order for life to be eternal.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: The Body can be replaced with something more durable. The Name can retain its meaning by being passed on through generations.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I know. That's the genesis of Sargonian noble heritage.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The Soul, however, is the frailest of the three.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: During the Age of Shadow, it was discovered that part of the Soul can be preserved, in a manner of speaking, by etching it upon a pure gem with Originium circuits.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Like the gem in your chest...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I've only ever read about it in ancient texts... Scholars call it superstition, borne out of a lack of understanding of the nature of life.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: That is a misinterpretation.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: However, the true mystery, the method by which a life's journey is engraved, has long since been lost to time.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Or, it might exist, to some degree... gems with engraved Originium circuits can still be found in this city.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Last year, a gem with Originium circuits that could change the ambient temperature in a small area was sold at auction for an incredible price.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Some things survive the test of time, only to become barely recognizable.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: The sun's about to rise. We should get back before the museum opens. Let's go.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The museum is just ahead. I don't want to crawl through another hole. Why don't we use your Arts to make a shortcut?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: One moment, Pepe.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Have you sensed the gem?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I would like to see the sunrise.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: The one thing that the passage of time cannot change.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Okay. Just for a bit.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: How lucky. It is still bright, glorious, brilliant.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: It still brings warmth.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Inudi harek, Horakhet.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Zubayr slumbered for centuries beneath the sands, with only darkness for company.
He squints straight at the sun rising in the east, the brilliant wheel of flame.
Sunlight shines upon him for the first time in a very long while, illuminating his golden body.
Pepe can barely open her eyes, so bright it is.
Is it time to go back?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: You can stay a while longer, if you like being in the sun.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: We have a little bit of time.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The sun is up.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Four days... no, five, since Narantuya went missing.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Focus, Ajazi! This work requires attention to detail!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: You're sure that the communicator fell into this drainage outlet when we left the museum, right?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: I'm sure.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Well, we've been dredging through it every day, but we haven't found a shadow of it.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: We can't reach Narantuya if we don't find it. if we can't reach Narantuya... what will we do?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: ...I remember Narantuya saying we should find a way to get money when she's not around.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: You're right, Ajani!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: We need to pull a big job.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: That way, we can buy a new communicator and get in touch with the boss!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Let's go. We've got work to do at the museum.
attributes.name: Ajazi
Ajani
attributes.content: Alright...

attributes.name: Ajani
attributes.content: Huh?
Hey, Ajazi, I think I hooked something!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: What do you think, Lazvar?
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: A hue like the night sky, and the wavy patterns it like lava gently flowing across it...
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: It was dug up from the deep Obsidian veins decades ago. It's a rare treasure today, given the state of Mount Siesta.
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: The gem vendors in town dare not give a hasty quote for it, and you've been away from the post these past few days...
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: There is no Originium circuit on this gem.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: I'm afraid I cannot give you a high price for it.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: The blue fowlbeast that was perched on the overseer's staff flies up, grabs the Obsidian, and places it gently on the scale.
The scale comes to a halt, and the young overseer looks at the reading.
Three hundred and seventy dinars.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: B-But a Siestan collector offered a much higher price for it! The equivalent of thirty-seven thousand dinars!
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: Could you perhaps be mistaken?
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: You could always go back to that collector.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Ah, er, well, it's not that I don't trust the overseer's eyes and scales...
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: But if we were in Londinium, Lungmen, or Siesta...
attributes.name: Eager Woman

attributes.content: We're in Menat-Ha'mait.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: There are treasures here beyond reckoning. The sand beneath your feet was perhaps at one time gems brighter than the stars.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: That is why we value the power of a gem far more than its appearance.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Three hundred and seventy dinars is the most I can give for an ordinary Obsidian, with no Originium circuits or special powers.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Can we really sell a rock that we reeled in from the sewers?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Even the roads in this city are paved with gems. Try holding it under the sun.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: What am I supposed to see?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Nothing. It's like the plastic handle of my toothbrush.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Well, don't be discouraged, Ajani. It could help Narantuya's great endeavor, even if it's not worth much.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Like, she could enjoy ice water for an entire week once she comes back. Added with lemon slices and dried dates for sure.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Hey, you! Yeah, you, behind the counter.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Yeah. You're the receptionist, right?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Receptionist? No—
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: It's our first time here. We want to... to... what do we want to do, Ajazi?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: To get this gem appraised and sell it for good money!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Yeah, that's right. Do you know where the queue for gem appraisals is?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: ...Give it to me. I can appraise it.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Wow, even the receptionist at the gem trading post knows how to appraise gems!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: At first glance, it is a pale sapphire of low-purity.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Low-purity? Sounds like dried dates are off the menu.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Well, the lemon slices still have a chance.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: The Originium circuits are clearly visible. Hm? This is...
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: What is it? Is there something wrong with the circuits?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Meh, never mind, Ajazi. The gem probably doesn't do anything, judging by his reaction.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: ...No, it does. The Originium circuits on this gem can induce excitement in small animals.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: It makes small animals excited...?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Where are you going, Ajani?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Back to work at the museum, of course! You know how much money we're making per hour carrying boxes?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Forget that blue toothbrush handle! Can't afford to waste our time here!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Hey, wait for me!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Wait, your gem—
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: I was going to say I could offer fifty thousand dinars for it...
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Meow...
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Mio? You're back early.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: (Dejected) Meow...
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: ...It's okay, you tried. It's not easy to see him, is it?
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Hey, Mio, try this.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: (Touches the pale blue gem with a paw)
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: (Sniffs)
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: (Purrs excitedly)
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: (Rolls in ecstasy)
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Glad you like it... what's that? You found your motivation again?
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Alright, then, go with Woof to find the gems.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: They've finally converged upon this city.
attributes.name: Lazvar
